posts.cooked:
Wouldn’t it be sneaky to have the Material You Integration on Signal?
Maybe Google would even feature the App if it has this feature. It would also remove the Design and color argument many people have…

As far as I know Google has not yet released the necessary information & guidelines to developers. So it might still be a while before Signal devs would even be able to implement this.

Though I agree that it would look great. And it might even convince a few more people to use Signal – namely those who do not necessarily care about privacy but want to use good-looking apps. Just look at the praise that Telegram often gets for its looks, despite being a privacy nightmare.

posts.name: ch4tterb0x
posts.cooked: Do you by chance have a link to what „Material You Integration“ is?

The Idea from Material you is to integrate the System colors in apps.
It’s pretty cool.
There are no statement how you implement it yet but maybe soon…
Just wanted to start the discussion as early as possible

Have a look here:

Material Design

Unveiling Material You - Material Design

The next stage for Material Design

They are now accessable via the regular system colors in android 12!

Have a look here:

Android Developers

R.color  |  Android Developers

Material You integration would be a very cool feature to have on Android (12). It would boost Signal’s visual appeal from “fine” to “fantastic” while raising the app’s profile. Not many 3rd party apps use Material You right now, so the faster the devs move on this, the larger the chance that Signal can be highlighted as a flagship Material You app.
% my opinion - maybe we could also create a material you Themed Icon for the Pixel Beta feature

oh good, now I can have all my contacts chat bubble colours change based on my wallpaper.

that should make them easier to identify

but actually, material you support would be good… if only for the basics like send buttons and whatnot.

easy UI win and boy does it need it.

Signal’s default bubble color for Android should just be the material you colors.
Jep that would be great there is as far as i know no guidelines out there but probably soon!!

It’s like a Holo app on Android 5.

Which looked much better than “material design” IMO, but that is definitely a matter of taste. I hate that minimalistic style where you don’t see immediately if something is a button or clickable or not.

posts.name: Renganathan Ramamoorthy
posts.cooked:
So true. I feel like the integration can be as simple as having the “material you” color be the choice on the “chat colors” page and that matches the same hint but different hue of the keyboard hint (depending on light / dark mode).

Feel like that would be a good start while they iterate how to best incorporate it.

Agree that Signal on android should implement Material You. At least make an icon that follow the color theme lika all the native apps. New version 3 of material design here:

Material Design

Material Design

Build beautiful, usable products faster. Material Design is an adaptable system—backed by open-source code—that helps teams build high quality digital experiences.
side suggestion: just implement the moving start up animation feature of android 12 - telegram just put it in and i forgot it was a feature lol

posts.name: Rishi Singhal
posts.cooked:
Yoo that’s only available on Android 12 or later it’s called animated splash screen it would have looked super awesome and makes app startup delightful although when I asked Dev’s to target Android 12 I mentioned about splash screen. Some apps like
Gmail
Telegram
Calender
Chess
Etc already implemented animated splash screen boy it makes app launching hell’a satisfying sadly Signal Devs showed no intrest in animated splash screen.

posts.name: link ✦
posts.cooked:
Material You integration is planned:

Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 5.41 release

In a future release, we plan on providing an option for the app color theme to match the phone color theme (which is something you can do on Android 12). I believe the intention is that the light blue buttons you see will be the buttons that can (optionally) change color to match your phone theme.

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 5.41 release
